rev.comment: This image use does not comply with [[WP:NFCC]] #10c and MUST be removed until it does. Thank you.
rev.diff:
Line 227: Line 227:
===In popular culture===
===In popular culture===
â
[[Image:Worker and Parasite.png|right|thumb|200px|"Worker and Parasite", a reference to [[Eastern Europe]]an animation, is one of [[Matt Groening]]'s favorite moments from ''The Simpsons''.<ref name="Groening"/>]]
 
''[[The Simpsons]]'' characters, ''[[Itchy & Scratchy]]'', of the cartoon on the ''[[Krusty the Clown]]'' Show, are spoofs of ''Tom and Jerry''--a "cartoon within a cartoon."<ref name="DailyTeleL"/> The extreme cartoon violence of the ''Tom and Jerry'' is parodied and intensified, as Itchy (the mouse) dispatches Scratchy in various gratuitous, gory fashions. In the ''Simpsons'' episode, ''[[Itchy and Scratchy and Marge]]'' [[Marge Simpson|Marge]] gets violence banned from TV and Itchy and Scratchy became friends (their whacking intro is replaced by gift-exchanging), causing the downfall of the series. It was later changed back to the way it used to be because Marge decided that art shouldn't be censored because she didn't want [[Michelangelo]]'s [[David (statue)|David]]'s nudity to be covered up.
''[[The Simpsons]]'' characters, ''[[Itchy & Scratchy]]'', of the cartoon on the ''[[Krusty the Clown]]'' Show, are spoofs of ''Tom and Jerry''--a "cartoon within a cartoon."<ref name="DailyTeleL"/> The extreme cartoon violence of the ''Tom and Jerry'' is parodied and intensified, as Itchy (the mouse) dispatches Scratchy in various gratuitous, gory fashions. In the ''Simpsons'' episode, ''[[Itchy and Scratchy and Marge]]'' [[Marge Simpson|Marge]] gets violence banned from TV and Itchy and Scratchy became friends (their whacking intro is replaced by gift-exchanging), causing the downfall of the series. It was later changed back to the way it used to be because Marge decided that art shouldn't be censored because she didn't want [[Michelangelo]]'s [[David (statue)|David]]'s nudity to be covered up.
